title: Distortion (mathematics)
summary: In mathematics, the distortion is a measure of the amount by which a function from the Euclidean plane to itself distorts circles to ellipses.  If the distortion of a function is equal to one, then it is conformal; if the distortion is bounded and the function is a homeomorphism, then it is quasiconformal.
